q:
Mike is working on an ASP.NET Web application. He is in the process of designing the complete architecture of a web application in ASP.NET Core but he also wants to decide the usage composition of cookies for authentication, then which of the following statements are the valid reasons that can impose a threat of CSRF attacks on your application?

Statements:

  1. Browsers store cookies that are issued by a web application.
  2. Stored cookies include session cookies for authenticated users.
  3. Browsers send all the cookies that are associated with a domain to the web application on every request regardless of how the request to the application was generated within the browser.
  4. Browser cookies are cleared periodically.

Paul is asked to build an application in ASP.NET. He was working with the Finalize method in it. He wants to know which of the following statements from the options is true about the Finalize() method?

a.option: If an object implements the Finalize() method, the garbage collector makes this object as unreachable.
If an object life cycle ends, then the Finalize() method can be invoked manually.
If the Finalize() method is used, the object will never remain in memory even when object is unreachable.
If an object implements the Finalize() method, the garbage collector will not make this object unreachable.

q: Mike is asked to build an application in ASP.NET. He wants to know in which of the following events will Session_End be raised?

a.option: App pool cycle recycles on schedule

q:
Mike is asked to design a webpage with the following fields:

  • Name
  • Email
  • Password
  • Confirm password

It is mandatory to fill the Password and Confirm password fields and the information entered should not be visible. Also, the values in the Password and Confirm Password fields should match. Which of the following validators will he select for the aforementioned task?

In ASP.NET, by default, the maximum upload size of a file on .NET websites is 4MB but Paul wants to increase this limit. Which of the following options will he add to the web.config file to increase the default limit?
Options

  1. <system.webServer>
   <security>
         <requestLimits maxAllowedContentLength="1073741824" />
   </security>
 </system.webServer>

  2. <system.webServer>
   <security>
      <requestFiltering>
         <requestLimits maxRequestLength ="1073741824" />
      </requestFiltering>
   </security>
 </system.webServer>

  3. <system.webServer>
   <security>
      <requestFiltering>
         <requestLimits maxAllowedContentLength="1073741824" />
      </requestFiltering>
   </security>
 </system.webServer>

  4. None of these

In ASP.NET, which of the following statements about master pages is true:

  1. The master page Init event occurs before the page Init and Load events.
  2. The master page Load event occurs after the page Init and Load events.
  3. The master page Load event occurs after the page Init and before the Load events.

Options:

  2. The CreateChildControls() method can be overridden.

Anita is working on an ASP.NET Web application. She implemented the following code to shortlist candidates for a singing competition as shown below:

Code:

if(FileUploadControl.PostedFile.ContentType == "image/jpeg")
{
    if(FileUploadControl.PostedFile.ContentLength < 25600)
    {
        string filename = Path.GetFileName(FileUploadControl.FileName);
        FileUploadControl.SaveAs(Server.MapPath("~/") + filename);
        StatusLabel.Text = "Upload status: File uploaded!";
    }
}

Which of the following are the possible use cases for the above code:

Options:

  1. For verification, a passport-size photograph (size: 25 KB or less) must be uploaded.
  2. For review, participants should upload a video (size: 25 MB or less) of themselves singing.
  3. During the audition, all documents required for verification should be uploaded.

Mike is working on an ASP.NET Web application. While developing a secure web page in an ASP.NET web forms application, he decides to set up a password recovery and reset feature. He has done this by modifying the code in Forgot.aspx.cs of the account folder, then which of the following lines of code is most unlikely to appear in the specified section of this method?

{

}

Options:

  1. string something = somevar.GeneratePasswordResetToken(user.Id);
  2. ForgotPasswordHyperLink.NavigateUrl = "Forgot";
  3. ErrorMessage.Visible = true;
  4. ErrorMessage.Visible = false;

maxWaitChangeNotification="10"

Consider the following statements in respect to ASP.NET. Then, which of these observations about these statements is/are correct?

  • Statement 1: Applications should choose a basic and descriptive routing scheme.
  • Statement 2: A basic and descriptive routing scheme must be selected so that URLs are readable and meaningful.

a.option: Statement 1 is true and statement 2 is the correct explanation for statement 1
Statement 1 is true and statement 2 is not the correct explanation for statement 1

  2. Logs exceptions

Mike is working on an ASP.NET Web application. He has implemented the following code in the web.config file. Now, A user has put an object in Session and a request is made at time t = 0 min. If no further requests are made, then which of the following statements correctly depict the state of the object at time t = 25 min?

Code:

<configuration>
  <location path="XYZ">
    <system.webServer>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms loginUrl="~/Auth/SignOn.aspx" timeout="30" slidingExpiration="true" />
      </authentication>
      <sessionState timeout="20" />
    </system.webServer>
  </location>
</configuration>

a.option: The user is still authenticated and the data in the session is also present.
The user is no more authenticated and the data in the session is not present.
The user is no more authenticated but the data in the session is present.
The user is still authenticated but the data in the session is not present.

Statements

  2. Garbage Collection provides safety to the memory by confirming that the object cannot use the content of another object.

Inferences

B is the copy of only the structure of D where as A is the copy of both structure and data of D.

Code:

  2. The 3-tier architecture is a client-server architecture that divides the app into user interface, business object layer, and data access layer while the MVC divides an app into model, view, and controller.
  3. Both of these
  4. None of these

Which of the following deductions are valid with respect to the code snippet given alongside?

using (var context = new BloggingContext())
{
 var blog = context.Blogs.Find(1);
 blog.Name = "The New ADO.NET Blog";

 bool saveFailed;
 do
 {
 saveFailed = false;

 try
 {
 context.SaveChanges();
 }
 catch (DbUpdateConcurrencyException ex)
 {
 saveFailed = true;

 // Update the values of the entity that failed to save from the store
 ex.Entries.Single().Reload();
 }

 } while (saveFailed);
}

1. The values of the entity that failed to save from the store are updated
2. The Reload method is used here to overwrite the previously saved values of the entity

The generic collection implements the non-generic System.IComparable interface

q:
Which of the following deductions can be made with respect to the code snippet given alongside?

private class Unsubscriber : IDisposable
{
 private List<IObserver<Temperature>> _observers;
 private IObserver<Temperature> _observer;

 public Unsubscriber(List<IObserver<Temperature>> observers, IObserver<Temperature> observer)
 {
 this._observers = observers;
 this._observer = observer;
 }

 public void Dispose()
 {
 if (! (_observer == null)) _observers.Remove(_observer);
 }
}

1. This code enables the subscriber to call the object's IDisposable.Dispose of implementation to remove itself from the subscriber's collection.
2. This defines a provider to store references to observers so that each observer can be notified when appropriate.

A small logistic management company has 20 managers situated at different locations in a country. The company has installed a desktop application on each manager's laptop to help them create daily report of the orders placed and deliveries accomplished. Currently, managers send their reports to the owner via mail. The owner however wants to generate and check the report on his own anytime he wants. To do so, he decides to create a web application in .NET.

Which of the following concepts of design pattern would solve the owner's problem?

In .NET, you are using a non-generic Hashtable collection class. The requirement is to replace the usage of Hashtable in your implementation with its generic counterparts in order to introduce type safety.
Which of these are valid counterparts to be used in the given scenario?

You have enabled a custom convention as given alongside when working with .Net Entity Framework 6.

Which of these code snippets can you use to configure all properties called Key to be the primary key of their entity only if they are an integer?

public class ProductContext : DbContext
 {
 static ProductContext()
 {
 Database.SetInitializer(new DropCreateDatabaseIfModelChanges<ProductContext>());
 }

 public DbSet<Product> Products { get; set; }

 protected override void OnModelCreating(DbModelBuilder modelBuilder)
 {
 modelBuilder.Properties()
 .Where(p => p.Name == "Key")
 .Configure(p => p.IsKey());
 }
 }

Ben is working on an ASP.NET Web application. He has implemented the following code snippet in the web.config file, then which of the following statements is correct with respect to the given code?

Code:

<authentication mode="Forms">
  <forms loginUrl="~/Auth/SignOn.aspx" timeout="30" slidingExpiration="false" />
</authentication>
<sessionState timeout="20" />"

Statements:

  1. The authentication cookie expires after 30 minutes regardless of whether the user makes a request within 30 minutes of the first request made.
  2. The authentication cookie expires after 30 minutes only if the user does not make a request within 30 minutes of the first request made.
  3. The authentication cookie expires after 20 minutes regardless of whether the user makes a request within 30 minutes of the first request made.
  4. The authentication cookie expires after 20 minutes only if the user does not make a request within 20 minutes of the first request made.

Mike is working on an ASP.NET Web application. He implements the following tag helper code in ASP.NET 1.0, then which of the following options is used to make the tag helper code valid in ASP.NET 2.0?

<environment names="Development,Production">
  <strong>HostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName is Development or Production</strong>
</environment>

Options:

  <strong>HostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName is Development or Production</strong>
</environment>
  2. <environment include="Development,Production">
  <strong>HostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName is Development or Production</strong>
</environment>
  3. <environment types="Development,Production">
  <strong>HostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName is Development or Production</strong>
</environment>"
  4. <environment names="Development,Production">
  <strong>HostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName = {Development,Production} </strong>
</environment>"

Mike is working on an ASP.NET Web application. He has implemented the following code snippet to concatenate strings as shown below:

Code:

Dim j As Integer
For j = 0 To 100000
  strn += j.ToString()
  Next j

Which of the following options is appropriate with respect to the given statements?

Statements:

  1. The method used for concatenating strings in the given code snippet is an expensive operation.
  2. The ASP.NET framework copies the existing and new data to the memory deletes the existing string and reads data in a new string.

Options:

  1. Both statements are correct and statement 2 is the correct explanation of statement 1.
  2. Both statements are correct and statement 2 is not the correct explanation of statement 1.
  3. Statement 1 is correct and statement 2 is incorrect.
  4. Statement 1 is incorrect and statement 2 is correct.

Mike is working on an ASP.NET Web application. He wants to send the same number of requests to two systems, one using the ISAPI model and the other working on a CGI model, then which of the following statements is most likely to be true in this scenario?

a.option: The number of processes created to service the requests is greater in the CGI system.
The number of processes created to service the requests is greater in the ISAPI system.
The number of processes created to service the requests are equal in both the systems.
Data insufficient to make any such claim.

q:
What is the purpose of the following code snippet in the web.config file?

Code:

<configuration>
  <location path="XYZ">
    <system.webServer>
      <authorization>
        <deny users="*"/>
        <allow roles="Admin"/>
      </authorization>
    </system.webServer>
  </location>
</configuration>

a.option: Allow only the admin to have access to XYZ folder.
Allow no one to have access to XYZ folder.
Allow admin to access all the folders except XYZ.
Allow everyone except the Admin to have access to XYZ folder.

  2. LiteralControl jsFile = new LiteralControl();

Tara is working on an ASP.NET Web application. She has a connection string in her web.config and wants the connection string to be changed to "validString" when the application is deployed; which of the following code snippets could she use to accomplish this?

Options:

  1. <connectionStrings>
  <add name="validName" connectionString="validString" />
</connectionStrings>
  2. <?xml version="1.0"?>
<configuration xmlns:xdt="http://schemas.microsoft.com/XML-Document-Transform">
  <connectionStrings>
    <add name="validName" 
        connectionString="validString" 
        xdt:Transform="Replace" xdt:Locator="Match(validName)"/>
  </connectionStrings>
</configuration>
  3. <?xml version="1.0"?>
<configuration xmlns:xdt="http://schemas.microsoft.com/XML-Document-Transform">
  <connectionStrings>
    <add name="validName" 
        connectionString="validString" 
        xdt:Transform="Replace" xdt:Locator="Match(name)"/>
  </connectionStrings>
</configuration>
  4. <?xml version="1.0"?>
<configuration xmlns:xdt="http://schemas.microsoft.com/XML-Document-Transform">
  <connectionStrings>
    <add name="validName" 
        connectionString="validString" 
        xdt:Transform="Replace" xdt:Locator="Match(name)" xdt:Action="Deploy"/>
  </connectionStrings>
</configuration>
